resources.string: One thing I don't miss from the old world - it was ambition for a man to chase a fortune, but greed for a woman. \n\nThat way of thinking doesn't hold much water on Aeternum, so that's something.
The Silver Crows
Grace O'Malley has developed a plan to found an enterprising new group of heroes who can work together to face the threats of Aeternum and possibly earn a little coin in the process.
Good to see you again, mate. Feels like there's been a lull in us adventuring together! \n\nI've been thinking, new threats keep rising up here… maybe we need a plan that takes that into account.
"Give up on escaping Aeternum?"

Grace O'Malley never gives up! I just changed my mind. It's not so bad on Aeternum, long as there's good company and good coin. \n\nSo I'm thinking we build on your reputation and start a heroes for hire sort of affair.
"Save Aeternum and get paid for it?"

Ah yeah, we're sailing with the same wind! We'd recruit the island's best talent, maybe call the operation "Silver Crows." \n\nYou'd captain the gang with me as First Mate - I'd even give you double share on prizes. What do you say?
"I'm in. We just need a hideout."

This camp's not much, but it beats that drafty old Caer Dun, and we can expand later, call it the Crow's Nest. \n\nOnly problem is some of those red-eyed bastards camping nearby. You clear them out, we're in business.
These pesky Corrupted keep turning up everywhere. \n\nI'm starting to get used to it.
Drive the Corrupted away from the outskirts of the Crow's Nest
Collect Supplies for Crows' Nest
Burn the Corrupted Tents
Use your supplies to build the Crow's Nest
Silver Crows
Crow's Nest Built
You've built a home base for the Silver Crows

Now we got a safe place for the Silver Crows to call home! It's time to start expanding the crew and earning some coin! \n\nI'd swear I've crossed this entire island ten times now, so I'll handle this place - you do the footwork.

I wonder if Aeternum will ever be rid of the legacy of the proud Knights of the Round Table. \n\nThat one of them now marches with the Varangians… Artorius would be crushed to learn his faith was so misplaced.

You know, after bumping around the island for so many months, this is the first time I've felt at home since I lost my ship. \n\nWith a little extra coin, we'll turn this place into a right proper estate, I think.
The Best of Aeternum
The Silver Crows need more members. Work with Grace to find additional heroes to join the group.
Now I've known you long enough to tell. \n\nSomething's bothering you, isn't it?
"When are we hiring more Crows?"
Matter of fact, I was just heading over to Mourningdale to post up some recruiting notices. \n\nCare to join me?
"Why Mourningdale?"
Well we've got to start somewhere. The way I see it, we need people with the mettle to sail through bad weather. \n\nAnd there's nowhere on Aeternum with worse weather than Mourningdale.

When I was Captain of the Satisfaction, I left the recruiting to the First Mate, thought it was a simple task, you know? \n\nTurns out it's a wee bit more difficult finding quality people… especially with you and me kinda setting the standard.
"I can help with recruiting too."

Well now, that'd be most welcome, posting flyers and conducting these interviews could be a team effort. \n\nI've been poking around different settlements, I think Mourningdale's the best place to recruit.
I can tell you don't like the idea of finding true talent by posting notices. \n\nBut you'll see, it's a mercenary company tradition.
Travel to Mourningdale to recruit new members for the Silver Crows
Post Silver Crows recruitment flyers in Grayvale Hamlet
By the Spirit Shrine
In the Artisan's Courtyard
Near the Town Hall
Meet Grace O'Malley at the tavern to interview candidates for the Silver Crows

There you are! I guess you must've gotten all those notices posted, because we got people lining up already.\n\nNot sure this is the best Aeternum has to offer - some of these volunteers seem a bit a dodgy.
"We have to start somewhere."

Now you're throwing my lines back at me? Never miss a chance to give me shite, do you?\n\nSo it is, though. We'll see what these folks have to say for themselves… let's just keep our expectations… low.
Alright, let's bring on the candidates then, shall we?
There you are! Been waiting for you to get started. Already got a few candidates lined up!
All right, who's first? Step up and let's hear your qualifications.
When I defeated the Tempest--
Next!
I am a great admirer of your mercenary company. To me, the Iron Rose has-- is this not the interviews for the Iron Rose?
I am a great admirer of your mercenary company.
To me, the Iron Rose has--
Is this not the interviews for the Iron Rose?
No it's not- next!
After years of meticulous study, I finally know the secret of the Ancients! They came from the future!
After years of meticulous study, I finally know the secret of the Ancients!
They came from the future!
Alright, we're done here. Ahh, this was a mistake, to be fair.
Oh, I don't shake hands. \n\nAh! You're to be my little junior Crow, are you? Well met, indeed!
Iron Rose, Silver Crows - anyone would have mixed the two. \n\nPerhaps you'd consider renaming your group to the "Iron Crows." Has more of a "Let your blade shine a light in the dark," feel to it.
Is it so ludicrous a notion to think the Ancients could come from the future? \n\nJust think on it.
Clearly, that was not the best of Aeternum. \n\nI could tell you didn't like this idea to begin with, and you were right. We need another way.
Zander the Undying
Grace has a great candidate in mind. Locate Zander the Undying and convince him to join the Crows.

Believe it or not, I've got a strong candidate to be our next Crow - a real mean fellow, an enforcer known as "Zander the Undying." \n\nSo tough, he's yet to die even once. He's been mauled, shot, poisoned, but never died.
"Impressive. Where's Zander now?"

Word is, he's left his old employer, a bit of a shady outfit, but that might not be so terrible. \n\nZander's hunkered down in a small cabin over in Edengrove. He's expecting you, so go talk to him and then you make the call.
This Zander character seems like he'd round out our team pretty well. \n\nLet me know what you think.
Find Zander the Undying
Speak to Zander the Undying in Edengrove about joining the Silver Crows
Ahh! No! No claw! Listen to me, baby cat. Scratch me one more time, and I will bake you into a pie. It will be very hot, and sugary, and-- OW!
Ahh! No! No claw! Listen to me, baby male cat-
Scratch me one more time, and I will bake you into a pie.
It will be very hot, and sugary, and-- OW!

Hm, so you're the boss of the Silver Crows, eh? Yes of course, I have heard of you and your mighty deeds. \n\nYou're the infamous commander who came to Aeternum on a ship, and upon landing, tragically fell to Corruption.
"That's Thorpe. I defeated him."

Hm. Even more impressive! But I cannot join the Crows right now - this sick little kitty has a greenish color and needs my help. \n\nWhat can I do? Little fellow's too weak to bring to a healer, and I cannot leave him here alone.
"I'll get some medicine for him."
Well now, that would be very good of you. Find Eynon the Druid - he'll have something to treat him. \n\nBrave little kitty! Our new friend's going to get you some medicine… don't you worry.

Even on Aeternum, I do not think of death lightly. Who knows what is taken from you when you die? \n\nAre you truly the same person? Or someone else, using your body, thinking your thoughts. It is… unsettling.
(The baby lynx kitten greets you with a weak meow. He seems to like you.)
Talk to Eynon the Druid about getting medicine for the baby lynx

If you're a hunter, hoping to trick me into giving you the location of some creature's den, don't bother. I'm wise to that.\n\nIf you're hoping to learn how to talk to animals, there's a waiting list… and it's long.
"I need a cure for a poisoned lynx."

Oh no, another one with the green complexion? \n\nFirst a goat with potato eyes, then a bear with ears of corn! Animals turning into plants… nature's a trickster, even for a druid, but I'd say someone's behind this.
"Do you have a cure?"

Oh… yes. This recipe is for a treat to reverse the process, but don't let the kitty near water for two days after they eat it. You're welcome. \n\nRemember, Eynon heals all animals. Except squirrels, the dirty little hoarders.
Yes, I know, the typical druid, standing under an overlarge tree! That's what I am. \n\nBut let me just say, I do not prance about in nothing but laurel leaves, and I hold no love for squirrels.
Gather ingredients for Eynon's Purifying Pâté anti-toxin
Gather Azoth Sap from Extractors
Collect a Gator Liver from Black Alligators
Collect Verdant Essence from Angry Earth
Craft Eynon's Purifying Pâté at a Cooking Station or at your Camp
Return the Purifying Pâté to Zander
(The baby lynx kitten purrs. He seems to recognize you.)
Thank you, my friend. This is very clever, making a treat to heal the kitty-cat. \n\nI must think about this some more. Perhaps I can create a new recipe or two of my own for the little fellow.
"You like to cook?"
Of course! What about me does not suggest that I love to cook? \n\nEveryone knows me as Zander the Baker, yes? Ah, just wait until you try my lemon cakes.

Of course! What about me does not suggest that I love to cook? \n\nEveryone knows me as Zander the Baker, yes? Ah, just wait until you try my lemon cakes. Oh, I guess that means I'll join you. Go on, I'll meet you there.
Canon and Coin
Help Zander find a way out of his organization.

About your Silver Crows, I would like to join, but there's a slight problem. \n\nMy current employer, Granny Pike, she gets… attached. She buried a man alive for a day after he was thinking of leaving her employ.
"What happened to him?"

You are speaking to him. After she released me, she said I could take time away, but leaving would never be an option. \n\nMaybe you can change her mind? It's up to you, but without her approval, I'm stuck.
If you talk to Granny, be… diplomatic. \n\nI can still hear the sound of dirt hitting the lid of that coffin.
Talk to Zander's former employer, "Granny"

Oh, I know who you are - you've been talking to Zander. Yes, Granny has eyes everywhere. Don’t forget it. \n\nAnd you can give up on recruiting Zander. He won't join your little band of greedy do-gooders.
"Won't or can't?"

Clever, you. Too clever gets the cleaver, hm? Alright, you've got steel in your spine. \n\nDo me a favor, and I'll consider it. There's a church in Calvary, in Brightwood, it's under construction… for years now.
"Why for so long?"

That's what I want to know. Our organization's paying to rebuild it - we see it as a way of giving back to the community.\n\nBut someone's skimming our funds. Find the thief, recover our coin, and we'll talk about Zander.
Ah, Zander, I'm too soft on that child. \n\nHaving a kind heart won't do him any favors in this world.
Visit the Calvary church to investigate thefts
Interview the guards for clues

Sent you with replacement funds, did they? Well let me tell you what I think-- Shut your trap Amis, what do you know? \n\nI say it's that lurking priest! He took the money, so they don't have to pay the builders!
"How does that help the church?"
Yeah, well, I'm still sorting it all out, but it's coming clear, all right. \n\nClear as the wind coming through those great big holes in the roof!
Some people think money don't matter on Aeternum. They're wrong. How'd you like to be poor forever? We still want to eat, right?\n\nYou know, have to hang our coat up somewhere. Think about it.

Sure, put the coin inside, but Marty and me are taking a break soon. Here, last time, we weren't gone more than a few minutes, and it disappeared.\n\nIt's one of those specters we seen out on the moors, I swear it!
"Why would a specter need coin?"
Don't you know about Brightwood? How they used to bury people alive? \n\nSo now there's one of them back for revenge, figures we owe him for all the suffering he's been through.

Have you heard? That pirate lady's got a new crew going by the name of the Silver Crows. \n\nWonder if they might hire on me and Marty. I mean, I'm a fair shot. As long as the target don't move around.
Ask the priest about the stolen funds

If you're here with money from Granny, leave it in the cabinet on the far wall, and thank you for your service. \n\nSad isn't it? We came to this land of plentiful life and bounty, and yet - and yet our greed, ambition, hunger - nothing changed, did it?
"Any idea why some of the money is missing?"

It could be anyone. The guards, Beatris, myself, none of us make much coin. Ah, but I'm not sure my opinion matters. \n\nI'm just happy they decided to restart the construction. It will be joyous to see this place restored.
May the Spark watch over you, my friend. \n\nI hope you find succor and company here in our humble house, such as it is.
Store the fake funds in the cabinet
Now that you've planted the funds, find a good vantage point to watch for the thief. Perhaps the rooftop…
Find a good spot to watch for the thief

string.comment: (if it helps, these would be the words: "Ohhh, if you want a girl who can dance and sing, sew pretty lace of some birds on the wing…")
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: Daaah, ta da da da da daa da da daa da daahh, dah dah dah hm hm hm hm hmmm…
Confront Dicun about stealing the funds
Ah! My goodness but you gave me quite the start! \n\nFunny that you're here. I was just checking to make sure your funds were secure.
"I saw you taking the coin."
Oh no! No, no! Have mercy, please, don't tell Granny! \n\nI haven't touched a coin of what I took before, you'll see, I'll tell you where I hid it!
It may sound pathetic to you, for an old man like me to say I've changed, but it's true. \n\nYou've allowed me to redeem myself. And I will. I'll make sure you are rewarded for your faith in me.
Travel to Brightwood Isle to find Dicun's hidden loot
Recover Granny's funds from Brightwood Isle so she'll let Zander join your team
It sounds like Dicun's voice outside the cabin- has he followed you here?
Investigate the voice you heard
Catch Dicun!
Time remaining: {timeRemaining}
It seems that Dicun's gone for now. And good riddance.

string.comment: Dicun shrieks as he runs from the player
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: Ah! How did you escape from there?

string.comment: Dicun shrieks as he runs from the player
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: Ahh! No!!

string.comment: Dicun gives up as he's caught by the player running
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: All right, all right, y-you caught me! I'll make a full confession, I swear it!
Return the church renovation funds to Granny
You recovered the stolen funds, I see. You're as clever as I had you figured to be. \n\nNow, what say you tell me who was the culprit?
"Does it matter? You got your money."

Ha! I get it! You're running your own little protection racket now, are you? \n\nI was going to hire you, but there's only enough room for one big fish in this pond. So get on with you - our deal is one and done.
"What about Zander?"
Fine. He's yours, for now. Tell him Granny Pike said-- \n\nAh, damned dust. Go on, leave me be, child.
If it isn't the Clever Cleaver. How's my Zander doing? \n\nDon't be too soft on him, it's not good for that boy.
Meet Zander at the Crow's Nest where he's gone to await Granny's answer
Granny Pike told you that I could join the Silver Crows? You are an incredible wonder. \n\nI feel the urge to hug you with all my strength.
"Uh, maybe later! Good enough you're here!"
Thank you. \n\nFor the second time in my life, I feel I have met a true friend.
The Silver Crows
Zander the Undying and Dog
You've recruited Zander the Undying and Dog to join your team
(Tell Zander about the priest)
And you also made the priest make a confession? Ah ha ha! \n\nThat is what they call a "metaphor," my friend.
"I think it's ironic."
Yes, it is also that.
No, Zander, we don't have a kitchen here, you can use the fire and a stick like everyone else. \n\nJust arrived and he's already making demands. Don't you start getting any ideas, all right?
This place may be small, but I feel it has a big heart. \n\nThere is a great warmth here, that speaks of family.
(The baby lynx kitten meows happily. You'd swear he was thanking you. He looks a lot better!)
First off, great work getting Zander to sign on, he'll be a great add to our team. \n\nSecond, that mangy dog he brought? It has to go.
"It's a baby lynx."

Dog…. Lynx... whatever it is, it has fleas, which is why I made Zander put it all the way over there. \n\nThe loathsome little thing keeps trying to sneak into my bedroll. I feel itchy just thinking about it.
You've found me! Well, this is exciting. There isn't a day that goes by that I don't think of you. \n\nMostly about our promised battle, but sometimes, other things as well.
The Empyrean Forge (Expedition)
Shailyn wants to uncover what Loth and his Varangians are doing in the Forge. Help her find Loth.
Your aura radiates a strength I've not seen in many, many years. There is a task, a heroic undertaking I must request of you. \n\nYou must help me defeat one of the Knights of the Round Table.
"Why would you want that?"

Because he has given in to madness and savagery, joined with the Varangians. \n\nSer Loth is who I speak of, and within the Empyrean Forge, his forces seek to claim a power that could be the unmaking of us all.
"What power is Loth seeking?"

An elemental force older even than the Ancients who built this structure in their twisted effort to control it. \n\nSer Loth and his allies would use this primal fire to reforge themselves as warriors of devastating might.
"Then how do I stop them?"

By any means necessary. If anyone has the potential, I sense it is you. \n\nStrike through our enemies to the heart of the Forge, and if any have received it's full power… gods help us, just do what you can.
I await news of your success, young one.
Enter the Empyrean Forge to find and stop Loth
Defeat Commander Marius

string.comment: Not sure if this line got recorded - it was in Shailyn's script
string.speaker: Ser Marius
string.name: Marius

resources.string: You are too late. Our master Ser Loth will seize the eldritch power that courses through these halls. \n\nI am to rid this world of the likes of you. Come and witness a taste of the power our lord will soon claim!

I watched from afar and saw Ser Loth's Varangian allies in quite a disarray. Whatever you accomplished in there - it must've worked. \n\nTell me, though, had any of them acquired the full power of the Forge?
"Yes, Commander Marius, but I defeated him."

That is a battle I would've liked to witness. You're as strong as I sensed. \n\nIf that loathsome serpent Loth escaped, I fear he will only pursue this endeavor with less restraint, but for today, I celebrate your victory.
A Toymaker's Request (Expedition)
Otmar is interested in collecting rare Apatite Gems to make runeglass to make his "toys." Help him find the gems in the Empyrean Forge.
Yes, hello, I'm sorry, I was just thinking about a new design for a toy. \n\nOtmar Winkler, of Winkler's Wonders. Ah, would you be going into the Empyrean Forge?
"I might."

Such providence! I am interested in obtaining Apatite Gems only found in the Forge. \n\nYou see, I use them to construct runeglass containers which can highly enhance the conductivity-- Ja, well, in short, to make my toys.
Did you know, I originally tried to run a sweets shop. Winkler's Aeternal Sweetmeats. \n\nMy favorite was the candied Spriggan liver. Ah, but my customers only cared for the toys.

Stand back or I'll-- Oh thank goodness, you're not one of those Forged, are you? \n\nFortunately, I was already hiding when they made their way to this area. Did Leonie give up and send you to find me?
"No, we’re searching for a way in."

Oh! I can help with that. I love puzzles, and well, the Ancients! \n\nYou'll just need to go in the other room, there's a puzzle in there I haven't figured out yet. Let me just unlock this device for you to activate it.
Venture into the Empyrean Forge to Gather Apatite Gems for Otmar
Gather Apatite Gems for Otmar
Defeat Marius and Escape with the Gems
Wonderful, you found the gems! Oh, you are-- well, a wonder! \n\nWith this, I can create at least two more Corrupted Ogre golems. And yes, yes, the eyes light up red, of course!
